issue.title: Animation does not load

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
Hi,
I created a simple animation with After Effects CC17 and used bodymovin to get the .json.
When I tried to use that .json file with the lottie-android library it does not load the .json file I put into my assets folder,
do you have any tips? 

[comp.zip](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/files/833696/comp.zip)

```

`    <com.airbnb.lottie.LottieAnimationView
        android:id="@+id/animation_view"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        app:lottie_fileName="data.json"
        app:lottie_loop="true"
        app:lottie_autoPlay="true" />
`
```

from my XML view

body: Can be done the same way image assets works utilizing Calligraphy (or just loading plain typefaces from assets)

issue.body:
I am having difficulty getting this and several other AE exports working.
Extra compositions also don't display, and it is quite a headache, even if they are being delayered very carefully.

This one was made very carefully and simply, yet it doesn't do it.

Any ideas?

[FallingBallTest.zip](https://github.com/martijn00/LottieXamarin/files/824741/FallingBallTest.zip)

body: @0legg Can you elaborate? If I'm just using roboto, you're saying just drop the font file in the assets folder and use `lottieView.setImageAssetsFolder("assets");`?

issue.title: Change Animation Text Dynamically [Android/iOS]

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
Hi,

We were trying use Lottie in our App (both Android and iOS) to create this animated map marker. I wanted to know if the text can be dynamically changed at runtime using Lottie as each Map Marker will have different data.

![marker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6376679/27171926-f3716e94-51d0-11e7-8437-52ac4e7e727a.gif)

In case there is any method that can be used in complement to Lottie for this purpose, that would be fine too. 

Would appreciate any help in this regards!

(Also attached the original After Effects file)

[Map_Pointer.zip](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/files/1077003/Map_Pointer.zip)

issue.title: Add support for rendering text glyphs

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
This adds support for rendering text when it is exported as glyphs by bodymovin.
Temporary super ugly Hello World. New assets coming.
![helloworld](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1307745/27527000-38a7e2f6-59fe-11e7-8bc8-425772e97a61.gif)


It supports:
- [x] Fonts
- [x] Colors (animated)
- [x] Tracking (animated)
- [x] Stroke color (animated)
- [x] Stroke width (animated)
- [x] Fill over stroke and stroke over fill

Fixes #173

body: Text glyph rendering now works! I'll open specific issues for further text enhancements and reference this one.

issue.title: Add support for rendering fonts and dynamic text

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
This support builds on text glyph support by supporting rendering custom fonts as well as custom text through a text delegate. This enables Lottie to be used with translations as well as interactive animations.

All text operations such as fills, strokes, tracking, etc are supported by this.

![dynamic-text](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1307745/27573075-b0748142-5ac4-11e7-82aa-1ca115cf63d2.gif)


#173
#349
#350
#352

body: Hi, I've tried exporting an animation via bodymovin that contains text and it still isn't displaying.  I've installed the release from a day ago. Any help would be appreciated
@fentonbutcher upgrade bodymovin to 4.9.0. You can also check composition.getWarnings(). It'll give you some hints.

@gpeal where do I check the composition.getWarnings().?
Also, I have checked 'Gliphs  - checked converts fonts into shapes'. I still can't see any text. Have upgraded to the most recent 4.9.0 version
@fentonbutcher Also make sure you have the latest Lottie (2.1.0)
@gpeal We're using Lottie it for react native. Has that also been updated?
@fentonbutcher not yet but try explicitly putting 2.1.0 in your gradle file to see if you can force it to use a newer version.
